div.p: In an effort to provide the most accurate information about coronavirus to our IAS staff and family, the following resources are from the CDC and the State of Georgia:
CDC: Guidance for Those Living in Close Quarters (for people who share a small apartment or for people who live in the same household with large or extended families)
CDC: Guidance for Care Givers (caring for someone with COVID-19 at home)

ul.li: Centers for Disease Control (CDC), Discussing COVID with students: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/daily-life-coping/talking-with-children.html

The National Association of School Psychologists (NASP), Discussing COVID with students: https://www.nasponline.org/resources-and-publications/resources-and-podcasts/school-climate-safety-and-crisis/health-crisis-resources/helping-children-cope-with-changes-resulting-from-covid-19
Unicef: How Teachers Can Talk To Students about COVID-19
Child Trends: Resources for Supporting Children’s Emotional Well-being
State of Georgia resources for social and emotional support during COVID-19: https://www.georgiainsights.com/uploads/1/2/2/2/122221993/ga_covid19_emotional_support_line_and_other_resources_flyer.pdf
ExcelinED: social and emotional learning resources for families and educators
